article.description: The article element represents a self-contained composition in a document

address.description: The address element indicates that the enclosed HTML provides contact information

aside.description: The aside element represents a portion of a document whose content is only indirectly related to the document's main content.

base.description: The base element specifies the base URL to use for all relative URLs contained within a document

body.description: The body element represents the content of an HTML document.

footer.description: The footer element typically contains information about the author of the section, copyright data or links to related documents.

link.description: The link element specifies relationships between the current document and an external resource.

head.description: The head element contains machine-readable information (metadata) about the document

header.description: The header element represents introductory content

html.description: The html element represents the root (top-level element) of an HTML document,

meta.description: The meta element represents metadata that cannot be represented by other HTML meta-related elements.

style.description: The style element contains style information for a document

title.description: The title element defines the text that is shown in a browser's title bar.
